segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool reaching for the cookie jar, and I can’t help but smile.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s so determined, even though that stool looks like it’s about to tip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is waiting for her share, and it’s adorable how patient she is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I remember doing the same thing when I was a kid.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman at the sink has no idea what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the boy doesn’t fall, but part of me is excited to see if he gets away with it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water overflowing is a mess, but the kids are the real story here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they’ll get caught before they finish the cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s face is so hopeful, and it’s making me grin.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost taste the cookies just by looking at them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is like a snapshot of childhood mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR
